dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis \"next-gen\" format is \u003ca href=\"https://rfcs.emberjs.com/id/0779-first-class-component-templates\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ethe official future\u003c/a\u003e of Ember's authoring\nstory, and is stable and usable today. (It is already being used in some of the\nlargest Ember apps in the world!) dir=\"auto\"\u003eLike Glimmer components, the primitive APIs for supporting imports were built\nbefore we decided on a final format for their high level usage in \u003ca href=\"https://rfcs.emberjs.com/id/0779-first-class-component-templates\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eRFC\n0779\u003c/a\u003e. There were a number of different ideas for how we can integrate\nimports with templates, and the idea behind this addon was that it could be a\ntest bed for them all. This allowed us to share common tooling between\nsolutions, and work together as a community as we explored the design space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe main alternative explored in a previous version was template literals,\nsimilar to the existing \u003ccode\u003ehbs\u003c/code\u003e helper in tests:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"import { hbs } from 'ember-template-imports';\nimport MyComponent from './my-component';\n\nexport default hbs`\n  \u0026lt;MyComponent/\u0026gt;\n`;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eimport\u003c/span\u003e { \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003ehbs\u003c/span\u003e } \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efrom\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003eember-template-imports\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e;\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eimport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003eMyComponent\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efrom\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003e./my-component\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e;\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eexport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003edefault\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-smi\"\u003ehbs\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e`\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e  \u0026lt;MyComponent/\u0026gt;\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e`\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e;\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFor the previous version of this addon, see \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/patricklx/ember-template-imports\"\u003ethis repository\u003c/a\u003e. class="pl-k"><</span>p<span class="pl-k">></span>Hello, {{@name}}<span class="pl-k">!</span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>p<span class="pl-k">></span>  <span class="pl-k"><</span>FancyButton @label<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Say hello!<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> {{on <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>click<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> greet}} <span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-k">></span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">This design uses <code><template></code> to allow us to author JavaScript or TypeScript inthe same file as templates, while keeping a clear separation between thetemplate language and the JavaScript around it.</p><p dir="auto">This "next-gen" format is <a href="https://rfcs.emberjs.com/id/0779-first-class-component-templates" rel="nofollow">the official future</a> of Ember's authoringstory, and is stable and usable today. (It is already being used in some of thelargest Ember apps in the world!) We expect it to become the recommended way ofauthoring <em>all</em> Ember apps in the near future, once we are satisfied that wehave sufficiently polished up all the corners of the implementation.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Installation and setup</h2><a id="user-content-installation-and-setup" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Using Template Tags and .gjs/.gts Files" href="#using-template-tags-and-gjsgts-files"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The new <code><template></code> tag format is available in <code>.gjs</code> and <code>.gts</code> files. Thesefile extensions represent a new file format "GlimmerJS" and "GlimmerTS", whichare supersets of standard JavaScript and TypeScript respectively. In thissyntax, templates are defined in JavaScript files directly.</p><p dir="auto">This example defines a template-only component, which is the default export of<code>hello.gjs</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// components/hello.gjs<template>  <span>Hello, {{@name}}!</span></template>"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">//</span> components/hello.gjs</span><span class="pl-k"><</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>  <span class="pl-k"><</span>span<span class="pl-k">></span>Hello, {{@name}}<span class="pl-k">!</span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>span<span class="pl-k">></span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You would be able to use this component in another component like so:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// components/hello-world.gjsimport Hello from './hello';<template>  <Hello @name="world" /></template>"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">//</span> components/hello-world.gjs</span><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-smi">Hello</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>./hello<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>;<span class="pl-k"><</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>  <span class="pl-k"><</span>Hello @name<span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>world<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> <span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-k">></span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You can also export the component explicitly:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// components/hello.gjsexport default <template>  <span>Hello, {{@name}}!</span></template>;"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">//</span> components/hello.gjs</span><span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-c1">default</span> <span class="pl-k"><</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>  <span class="pl-k"><</span>span<span class="pl-k">></span>Hello, {{@name}}<span class="pl-k">!</span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>span<span class="pl-k">></span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>;</pre></div><p dir="auto">Omitting the <code>export default</code> is just syntactic sugar. In addition, you candefine template-only components and assign them to variables, allowing you toexport components with named exports:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="export const First = <template>First</template>;export const Second = <template>Second</template>;export const Third = <template>Third</template>;"><pre><span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">First</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k"><</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>First<span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>;<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">Second</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k"><</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>Second<span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>;<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">Third</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k"><</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>Third<span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>;</pre></div><p dir="auto">This also allows you to create components that are only used locally, in thesame file:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const Option = <template>  <option selected={{@selected}} value={{@value}}>    {{or @title @value}}  </option></template>;export const CustomSelect = <template>  <select>    {{#each @options as |opt|}}      <Option        @value={{opt.value}}        @selected={{eq opt @selectedOption}}      />    {{/each}}  </select></template>;"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">Option</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k"><</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>  <span class="pl-k"><</span>option selected<span class="pl-k">=</span>{{@selected}} value<span class="pl-k">=</span>{{@value}}<span class="pl-k">></span>    {{or @title @value}}  <span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>option<span class="pl-k">></span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>;<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">CustomSelect</span> <span class="pl-k">|</span>opt<span class="pl-k">|</span>}}      <span class="pl-k"><</span>Option        @value<span class="pl-k">=</span>{{<span class="pl-smi">opt</span>.<span class="pl-c1">value</span>}}        @selected<span class="pl-k">=</span>{{eq opt @selectedOption}}      <span class="pl-k">/</span><span class="pl-k">></span>    {{<span class="pl-k">/</span>each}}  <span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>select<span class="pl-k">></span><span class="pl-k"><</span><span class="pl-k">/</span>template<span class="pl-k">></span>;</pre></div><p dir="auto">Helpers and modifiers can also be defined in the same file as your components,making them very flexible:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Like Glimmer components, the primitive APIs for supporting imports were builtbefore we decided on a final format for their high level usage in <a href="https://rfcs.emberjs.com/id/0779-first-class-component-templates" rel="nofollow">RFC0779</a>. There were a number of different ideas for how we can integrateimports with templates, and the idea behind this addon was that it could be atest bed for them all. This allowed us to share common tooling betweensolutions, and work together as a community as we explored the design space.</p><p dir="auto">The main alternative explored in a previous version was template literals,similar to the existing <code>hbs</code> helper in tests:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-gjs notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import { hbs } from 'ember-template-imports';import MyComponent from './my-component';export default hbs`  <MyComponent/>`;"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> { <span class="pl-smi">hbs</span> } <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>ember-template-imports<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>;<span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-smi">MyComponent</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>./my-component<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>;<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-c1">default</span> <span class="pl-smi">hbs</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">`</span></span><span class="pl-s">  <MyComponent/></span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">`</span></span>;</pre></div><p dir="auto">For the previous version of this addon, see <a href="https://github.com/patricklx/ember-template-imports">this repository</a>. Andhuge thanks to @patricklx for his contributions here!</p><p dir="auto">As of <a href="https://rfcs.emberjs.com/id/0779-first-class-component-templates" rel="nofollow">RFC 0779</a>, we decided on
